Thanks to you, the evil spirit incident was also resolved. However,
some of the summoned ones still remain. If you have time, please
continue to deal with it.

As you know, Megista was once the capital of the Del Kingdom. However,
the people rebelled against the tyrant known as the Undead King, King
Agol, and the throne passed to those who supported the rebellion and
were part of the royal family.

After that, it was decided to transfer the functions as the capital
city. That is the current capital city, Albedia, the White-Walled
City.

Regarding Albedia, known as one of the most beautiful cities in the
western continent, the glory of Megista, which was once the capital of
the Del Kingdom, is no longer present and there has been a continuous
outflow of talent since the capital was moved.

The Melgius family, which I lead, was originally a count family in
charge of the port town of Marusta, but was entrusted with the
territory around this former capital as a reward for supporting the
rebellion.

……Well, actually I heard that it was a good way to get rid of the
concern that we, as local nobles, had too much power. A convenient way
to pass the problem onto our household.

Agol Aman Del. He is said to be the rightful heir to the throne of the
Del royal family and the worst tyrant.

However, in reality, Megista flourished under that king's rule. Why
Agol is called the Undead King and a tyrant... The reason lies in the
magic that Agol used.

Agol was a member of the royal family and had excellent talent in
magic. With that magic, he controlled the dead, created immortal
soldiers, and made them fight or do simple farming.

Thanks to that power, Megista's productivity increased dramatically,
and it seems that the people's lives were very rich.

However, for various reasons, he had incurred the displeasure of the
surrounding lords. It is said that one of the major reasons was the
review of the existing aristocratic system.

Not only that, there were of course those who could not accept the
desecration of the dead through the use of magic.

In particular, the Rista Church. The church's scriptures strongly
prohibit anything that disturbs the peace of the dead.

The Rista Church did not originally act openly, but one believer took
the lead and criticized the Undead King.

The Saintess, Luminea. She was just a kind-hearted town girl, but it
is said that she could hear the screams of those who were still being
used even after death.

Those who had accepted Agol's reign gradually began to feel distrust
and unease towards the Undead King due to her persuasion.

Other powerful figures who did not originally welcome Agol as king,
such as the nobles, the royal family with inheritance rights, and the
clergy of the Rista Church, also began to move, and finally led to a
major rebellion.

Agol's army of undead soldiers was powerful and tireless. However,
that fearsome army was rendered powerless one after another by
Luminea's prayers.

And so, Agol was finally overthrown... and that is the record of the
rebellion in Megista.

Although there is a possibility that the details may differ since this
is a record from the winning rebel side, it is generally believed that
this is the truth based on the evidence found at that time.

About my family? The Merugius family was one of the first to
participate in the rebellion against the Undead King Agol.

Originally, the Marusta region adjacent to the former royal territory
was our family's territory. It seems that our family felt a sense of
crisis by witnessing Agol's reign up close.

No matter how excellent the labor force was, the fact remains that the
undead were wandering around the territory. Reading the notes of the
lord at that time, it can be seen that there was a considerable sense
of distrust towards the king.

As a result, the rebellion was successful and the Merugius family was
praised for their great achievements. They became one of the leading
local nobles in the kingdom, but it seems that they were dealt a
pretty bad hand in terms of expenses related to the aftermath of the
incident and the relocation of the capital.

For generations thereafter, it seems that members of our family had
some sort of conflict with the current royal family... I speak of it
as if it were someone else's problem, but I cannot say that I am
completely unrelated.
メギスタが抱える問題

Deterioration of the entire city, worsening public safety in some
areas. Insufficient military power due to the appearance of monsters,
and anxiety caused by ghostly disturbances.

The looting of ruins by grave robbers, smuggling of discovered
artifacts. The Black Vein Disease for which no cure has been found.
The decline of faith in the Rista Church may also be one of them.

However, it was found that many of the causes were due to the former
nobles. It will improve little by little from now on.

Many of the previous heads of the family worked hard on many things,
but unfortunately, my father... the previous head, is evaluated as
incompetent.

During my father's generation, the gap between the rich and poor
widened, public safety in the shady streets worsened, and many orphans
were born... It is inevitable that he would receive harsh evaluations
as a ruler.

In addition, there are some things that concern me about Megista. The
suspicious activities of shady people and the dubious merchants who
call themselves the Jemmet Company.

I am trying various things in my own way, but it seems that my
generation alone is not enough to solve all of these issues.
マップイベント呼び出し

\>How to Walk in Ruins ①\> -Beware of Grave Robbers- \>[Author: Dobby
Yamamoto]
If you see a grave robber

To explore ruins, you first need to qualify as an explorer. This is
because ruins have proper owners. Let's become legitimate explorers so
we don't become grave robbers.

If you become a legitimate explorer, you can legally explore within
permitted ruins. However, a percentage of the profits or discoveries
will be collected by the owners of the ruins.

However, if you explore without permission and take away what you have
discovered, you will become a grave robber. Of course, in most areas,
this act is considered a crime.

Furthermore, the maliciousness of grave robbing does not stop there.
This is because, in most cases, smuggling and trafficking are usually
involved.

In fact, in many cases, there are large criminal organizations such as
major thief groups behind grave robbers, and the majority of cases
involve grave robbers getting involved in various crimes.

Many people seem to get involved in grave robbing lightly and end up
unable to get out. To avoid going astray, grave robbing is absolutely
forbidden!

Also, be careful of grave robbers you may encounter during
exploration. Do not trust anyone who does not have a legitimate
explorer qualification certificate.

Most grave robbers are lawless or thieves, and many cases of explorers
being attacked occur, especially for women who may also be subjected
to sexual assault.

If you see a grave robber or encounter someone who may be a grave
robber, immediately leave and report to the guards or the Explorer's
Association.
And, please also follow the rules and enjoy your exploration life.

Since my husband passed away, I have felt like my soul has been
drained every day.

We had no children between us due to several problems, and my siblings
were already gone.

At that time, Father Merlec of the small church was looking for the
director of the orphanage attached to the church.

I felt a sense of destiny and decided to take care of the children at
the orphanage by all means.

The children living in the orphanage were mostly bright and good
children, but there were also children who were very cautious and
those who wouldn't easily open up, so it was difficult for me who had
no experience in child-rearing.

However, as I patiently faced them, time solved everything. I began to
feel that the more difficult the child, the cuter they were. Enicia,
who was mischievous, has recently become more expressive.
I have already grown quite old, but I felt as if a new life had begun.
Oh... is the inside of the house dark? Please don't mind...

My name is Enicia from the church on Horseshoe Street. I have been
requested by the lord to deal with the recent increase in evil spirit
incidents. Is there anything you need help with?

Ah, that church... Thank you for your kindness. I am a weaver, my name
is \n[51]...

I see, you came regarding the ghost incidents... Certainly, something
like ghosts have been wandering inside houses every night...
Well... then we must quickly drive them away...
No, no. I am not particularly troubled, so please do not worry...
Huh? Um, d-do you mean to say that you're okay...?

Yes, I am completely... spending my time thinking of my slightly
unusual roommate...

However, let's see... Apart from that, is there anything troubling
you?

According to what \n[51] said, it seems that the merchant's carriage
that always comes to purchase materials has recently been unable to
come to the town and has turned back.

The cause of this is said to be evil spirits that have recently begun
to appear on the Megista South Highway. When approaching the area of

it was said that they had no choice but to turn back.

That's why... We are lacking the materials necessary for our workshop
jobs.

We can also wholesale from companies like the Jimet Company, but it is
very expensive...

Of course, this is not just a problem for my store, but it is also
hindering various people who use the highway...

I see... I can't believe that evil spirits have appeared not only in
the town, but also on the highway...

The Megista South Highway is located in a slightly foggy area... It is
always dim and damp... Truly an excellent spot for evil spirits.

Some have tried to pass through using talismans to ward off evil
spirits, but it seems that it is only a temporary solution and not
profitable...

(...It seems like we should do something about it as soon as possible.
However, just defeating them might not be enough... I wonder if there
is some underlying cause.)

I see... That's tough. Of course, if there's anything I can do, I'll

It's nothing but trouble with grave robbers and monsters. The
territory is quite unsettled.

The ruins within the territory are basically all owned by the Margrave
family. Of course, the artifacts discovered there are also theirs, but

text = It has already been accepted

Thanks to you, the former knight named Ed Poppo, who was causing
abnormal monster outbreaks, has been secured.

However, there are still many monsters active. If you have some free
time, please deal with them.

I think you've heard from Nasuman, but there have been local abnormal
monster outbreaks in the Margius territory recently.

At the request of Lord Margius, we are asking available adventurers to
subjugate the monsters and investigate the cause.
If you have some free time, please cooperate with us.

Did you witness the battle of Mr. Bornica up close? They don't seem
human at all, do they? I think they are clearly of the ogre or troll
type.
Hey, don't praise people that much right in front of them.
……This is what kind of person she is.

That person sitting over there is Branch Manager Bornica. Be careful
because she tends to get violent when she's in a bad mood.
You've got some nerve doing that in front of people...
イベント呼び出し用。ページ番号変更禁止
I see... So this is what was found where the monsters were.

Hmm, I see... It looks like a meatball mixed with raw meat and herbs.
...But still, it has a terrible smell...

It doesn't seem like it's rotten... Maybe it's the smell of herbs.
Rather than food, it looks more like bait...

At least it's not something humans would eat. I can't handle this
smell alone... Ugh...

……However, it's also hard to imagine that someone would go out of their
way to feed the monsters.

This was found in the area where the monsters appeared abnormally...
We can't just assume it's unrelated.

I will investigate this meatball with the association. It would be
helpful if you could continue to receive special missions.

parameters.message:
It seems that the meat-like thing picked up in the abandoned
village is bait. Leave the investigation to the guild and
continue to fulfill special requests.

parameters:
message = I found something like meat in the abandoned village, it
seems to be food The investigation will be conducted by the
association…
I see... The usual bait again... It seems almost certain now.

Actually, there is something we have found out here. It's about that
bait.

The bait is a mixture of meat from animals and fish, and a certain
plant. That plant is the \c[6]black grass of Zymel\c[0].

It is a plant that mainly grows in the large forest of Gadalgah in the
north of the continent. It emits an indescribably strong odor, but
many monsters like this smell and gather around the black grass.

For explorers around Gadalgah, it seems to be common sense. If black
grass is growing, leave the area immediately, they say.

The black grass of Zymel is prohibited in this country from being
owned, traded, or cultivated. If it is discovered growing naturally,
there is an obligation to report it, and it will be immediately burned
by the knights. As stated before, this is due to its nature of
attracting monsters.
……It's a very dangerous plant. If it was mixed and used as bait...

Yes. There is no doubt that the monster uproar was intentionally
caused.

Anyway, thank you for your hard work. We don't have any further clues
at the moment, so please continue to receive special missions.

parameters.message:
Zymel's black grass, which attracts monsters, was mixed into
the feed. Although there are concerns, we will continue the
investigation with the special request.

parameters:
message = Zymels black grass, which attracts demons, is mixed into the
feed…

Hmm, I see... The usual bait, and torn cloth scraps. May I see them
for a moment?

……It may be a mistake, but it looks very similar to the embroidery on
the Megista knights' mantles.

Of course, it may just be a misunderstanding since it's only a part...
But, could it really be...?

(Excuse me, Knight... \c[6]Would it be possible to speak with that
person?\c[0])
(Knight... If there is someone who \c[6]can listen to me\c[0]...)

parameters.message:
There was a torn piece of what appears to be a knight's
mantle where there was monster feed. If there is a knight
who seems likely to listen to the story, let's ask them.

parameters:
message = There was a cloak that seemed to belong to a knight where
there was monster food…

I showed this torn cloth scrap to a person called Knight \n[35]. It
seems to be without a doubt a knight's mantle given by the lord during
the commendation ceremony.
So it was a scrap of a knight's mantle after all. But why...?

I don't know. According to Knight \n[35] who I spoke to, there are no
records of a knight acting in such a place....

You haven't reported anything, have you? Did that knight do something
shady...?

……If we assume that the culprit is a knight, there are parts that make
sense. Despite the recent strengthening of patrols by the knights and
guards, the culprit acted as if they knew the weak points of the
security.

……If it's a knight, it's possible to grasp internal information and act
without arousing suspicion.
No way, could it be that the knight did such a thing...

Of course, for now it's just a mere speculation. It's not yet decided
that the knight is the culprit, but since we don't know what they were
doing, it seems better to investigate.
For now, good work. I will report if I find out anything.

(It seems like there's nothing for me to do. \c[6]Let's wait a little
until there's some progress. \c[0])

parameters.message:
A suspicious person has emerged as the cause of the abnormal
increase in monsters. Let's leave the investigation to the
Explorer's Association and wait for progress.

parameters:
message = A suspicious person has emerged as the cause of the abnormal
increase in monsters…

Oh, hello. Actually, I was able to narrow down the person who I think
is the culprit. If you don't mind, please accept the request and head
towards the Vaux Old Mountain Road.

ヴVaux Old Mountain Road... Was it used for transportation during the
time of the capital?

Yes. Nowadays, there are few people who use it, and it's a dangerous
place where monsters have settled...

Actually, I asked another explorer to monitor the suspicious movements
of some knights. As a result, it was found that a knight named Ed is
quite suspicious.

The edge of his cloak has a torn mark on it... Furthermore, today he
headed towards the Vaux Old Mountain Road without his attendant.

Not only that, it has also been confirmed that she was purchasing old
fish and scrap meat at the market for almost nothing.
……Fish and meat... Could it be that they are ingredients for bait...?

Probably. Please confirm what that knight is planning to do. Of
course, if it's just a misunderstanding on our part, that's fine...

(If you accept the request, head towards the Vaux Old Mountain Road
\c[0])

parameters.message:
There has been movement from a suspicious individual
regarding the incident. Accepting a special request, let's
head towards the Vox Koyamamichi.

parameters:
message = There has been movement regarding a suspicious person
related to the incident Special request…

Well done. Sir Ed... no, Ed the Monster Tamer is being detained in the
underground cell. He will be stripped of his knighthood.

For now, there seems to be no worry that the monsters will continue to
increase and become unmanageable. You should be able to avoid being
urged by the lord. For some reason, the branch manager seems
disappointed though...
……Ah, ahaha... Anyway, why would a knight do something like this...

Well, she seems to be keeping her mouth shut... We'll find out during
the interrogation. What's particularly concerning is the route for
obtaining Zimmel's Black Grass...

Anyway, the special request is complete. It doesn't mean that it's
completely safe yet, but the knights and guards should be able to move
more easily now.
Well... if I could be of help, I would be happy.

parameters.message:
Enicia captured Knight Ed and resolved the abnormal increase
of monsters.

parameters:
message = Enicia captured Knight Ed and resolved the abnormal increase
of monsters
マップイベント呼び出し
Hello. It's about the special request, right?
マップイベント呼び出し

Is it you? Finally, the military force allocated to the monsters
within the territory has decreased, and I believe that His Lordship's
burden has also been slightly lifted.
マップイベント呼び出し

The explorer who was leaking information has been caught, making it
much easier to predict the movements of the grave robbers... Branch
Manager Volnica seems to be in a good mood after dealing with them.
マップイベント呼び出し

Was it you? You said you were kidnapped the other day... Is that child
doing well? If those thugs are causing trouble again, let me know.
I'll make sure to turn them into meatballs this time.
N-No... You don't have to go that far...

There are times when thugs pretend to be explorers and cause trouble.
Dealing with those kinds of things is also part of my job.

In any case, desk work doesn't suit me and my shoulders get stiff.
Someone please start a fight already. It's boring.

You solved it, didn't you? Not bad for a nun. How about it? Won't you
fight me?

I want to solve it quickly, but I'm still the branch manager. I'm busy
with boring paperwork. *sigh*

Well, we have to let even the rookies and staff members have some
achievements. Do your best, at least.

It seems like you've had various interesting experiences. It's a waste
to keep you as a nun... How about making being an explorer your main
profession?
N-No... I am a nun who serves Lady Rista.

I see. Well, about 20% of that was a joke... Anyway, there's a pretty
interesting place around here.

It's a certain ruin that is connected to an unidentified space. The
place that it is connected to is called the Dark Corridor \c[6], but
it is unclear what kind of place it is.

That ruin is not from the Carbain era, it's much older... It must be
from a faraway time.

Well, that's not the interesting part. The Dark Corridor changes its
structure every time you enter.

Phantoms of various monsters appear around the treasure that drifted
from somewhere... Every time you enter, you will encounter such
things.

It's not something that can be made public... but I'll tell someone I
can trust.

The 'Dark Corridor Ruins' is a random dungeon where the structure
changes every time you enter. You can also adjust the floor level.
Let's try challenging it.

Thanks to you reducing my workload, I feel like I can move more
freely. First, let's clean up those grave robbers.

I found it by chance during my explorer days. To be honest, the reason
I became the branch manager here was to investigate that place more
thoroughly.

I found various treasures, but it's not like I wanted to keep them all
to myself. Rather, it was also to prevent people from easily
approaching.

The Dark Corridor is a place full of mysteries and very interesting,
but on the other hand... one wrong step and it can become a terrible
threat. That's why I had a feeling about it.

Of course, that aside... for me, it's the perfect place to relieve
stress.
What should I say... I'm glad... right?
Ah...I'm starting to feel really motivated.

It can't be helped. If my salary is going to increase, I'll try a
little harder.
But, you know, dance for me again here.
Well, if I do that, I'll be motivated all the time.
……Okay, I understand... If I have time.

(I'm glad... it seems like she's motivated now. Should I report to Mr.
Block?)
The footprints stop here... which means... this must be the building.
They may be waiting for us. Let's be careful when entering.
……Are you a member of the kidnappers?

Kidnapper...? What's with the sudden question... Ah, that unfamiliar
hat-wearing person with the little girl. They certainly passed through
here...

Don't lump me in with them, I'm different. Well, I am involved in some
business that I can't really talk about though...

……I-Is that so. I apologize... If it's not too much trouble, do you know
where the person who took the little girl went?

Ah... Well, I wouldn't say I know for sure, but they're definitely
over there.

！　If you know, could you please tell me? Um... I will pay compensation
for it.

You're a nun from the church on Hooftstraat. My family was helped by
your healing magic before.
……S-So, is that so? Is that person doing well now?

Oh, thanks to you. ...Well, that's how it is. Don't think of it as a
repayment or anything.

Well, it's not really that useful information, but... The kidnappers
definitely went to \c[6]Marusta\c[0], the port town.
Marusta... Why do you think they went there?

The purpose of kidnapping is generally one of two things: human
trafficking or ransom. However, regardless of the purpose... they
often use port towns as their base so they can quickly escape across
the sea.
……I see. Alright, I understand. I'll try to believe that.
……But how can they get to Marusta from such an underground waterway?

……This is a secret passage. Even if you don't go through the main gate,
you can enter and exit the city through the underground waterway...
It's a place used by people like us.

That ladder leads outside the city walls. It's a path used by people
who engage in shady business...

Well, you can do whatever you like, whether it's keeping quiet or
telling the guards. More importantly, it's better to hurry up and
chase after them.
Well, I hope you'll be fine.

parameters.purpose:
According to the resident who was in the underground
waterway, there is a high possibility that \n[12] was taken
to the port town. Let's hurry and go help \n[12].

parameters: テキスト = 地下水路にいた住人によると、 \n[12]は港町に連れ…
Oh, so the kid from the other day is okay. That's good.
I hope the kid is okay. May you be happy.

The place you'll find if you go west is called Nikage Street. It's
dangerous the further you go, so don't go there.

Did you happen to see a red-haired girl? I feel like I saw her... but
I'm not sure. Hmm, wait a moment. Let me try to remember...

Did you see a red-haired girl? I feel like I saw one... but I'm not
sure. Hmm, wait a minute. I'm trying to remember now...

……I remember now...! \c[6] I feel like she was with a man wearing a hat.
\c[0]
……！ What kind of person was she...?

Hmmm... Because of the hat, I couldn't see her face... And her body
was also hidden by something like a cloak... However, there's no doubt
that she was a man based on her physique.

To be honest, her appearance wasn't particularly unusual for this
town, so I didn't pay it much attention...

Thank you. Do you remember any distinctive features about the red-
haired girl?

I see... She might have looked like the girl I sometimes see at the
market... But I didn't look at her closely, so I'm not sure.
I see... Was that girl being taken away against her will?

No, it didn't feel like she was being taken away forcibly. It seemed
like she was obediently following the person who was leading her by
the hand.

……However, now that I think about it carefully... I don't recall seeing
the girl.

(... At the moment, there is no information that can confirm that the girl
is \n[12]... But, it's concerning...)
Do you know which way the man and the girl went?

They should have gone towards the shady street. I think this is
certain.

It seems like something happened, but don't panic. Drink this and calm
down.
Oh, thank you very much. You're so kind...
I hope she's not caught up in something. Please find her quickly.
Well, it's better not to push yourself too hard.
I believed that you would come to help me. Thank you, Enicia.

I knew that Enicia was going through a lot... I'm sorry I couldn't be
of any help.

I leave the housework to \n[12]. Please protect the church in place of
 your older sister Enicia.
Yes, this is a bento box.
Pha... I slept very well last night.

If you believe the story I heard in the underground waterway, then
\n[12] should have been brought to Marsta....

parameters.purpose:
There is a high possibility that \n[12] was brought to
Marusta, but there is no further information. Let's try
asking around the town.

parameters: テキスト = \n[12]はマルスタに連れてこられた可能性が高いが、…

I see, understood. Although there is no evidence of the crime yet,
since they have admitted to it, they must be detained. We will
immediately arrange to capture \n[25] who is being guarded by the
guard unit.

……I see. At least for now, since we don't have any evidence other than
the name, we have no choice but to believe you if you say so.

Let's leave it at that for [25]. The remaining big problem is... the
Jemmett Company.

……Actually, the guard unit has just raided the Jemmett Company. However,
\n[21] was no longer there.

I see... Since you said that \n[25] has probably already fled, I was
thinking of relaying that information...

I see. Although the guard unit is continuing the search, there are no
clues at the moment. The Apostles also seem to be unaware. What should
we do...

We will continue with the investigation as is, but may we ask you to
inform us if you come across any leads?

Former explorer Bolnica. She left outstanding achievements since her
active days and left many dangerous anecdotes.

Due to her deviated combat abilities as an explorer and her rough
temperament, she was called Bolnica who goes too far and Bolnica who
uproots everything, and was feared in various ways.

As an explorer, she unusually preferred solo activities, but she was
weak in complex mechanisms that required magical knowledge.

However, she had a cooperative relationship with the famous Rainbow
Gem Rank witch, Cryer Shilin, and it was even said that there was no
unexplored region that the two of them couldn't conquer together.

On the other hand, it seems that she had many conflicts with Cryer
Shilin, and it was often witnessed that they were arguing in places
like the Association lobby.

After retiring, she became the branch manager of the association in
the Melgius region. It is not clear why she, who loved the unknown
more than anyone, retired at a young age and settled as a branch
manager of the local association.

Her reputation still remains, and it seems that even rough explorers
rarely cause trouble in the city of the former capital Melgius, where
the association branch is located.

Due to the nature of their activities, explorers are often involved in
crimes and their methods and significance are questioned in various
places. However, in Megista, it is said that she has become a great
deterrent.

(Perhaps because I was petted so much by the knight-sama, I feel
sulky...)
(She's cute... but when you pet her, she gets in a bad mood.)

You were originally supposed to spend your time at the monastery...
but the Megista Monastery has been closed due to a decrease in the
number of people. You will be spending your time at this church
instead.

Is that okay, Enicia? There are people in this world who we can't
reach no matter how much we try to help them. What do you think we
should do?
Do I wait until someone... takes my hand?
It may be mean, but there is no correct answer.

Just remember this. Not everyone who needs help will ask for it, and
there are also people who need help but don't realize it.

You may not remember... but you were the same when we met on the shady
street.

No matter how much effort you make to understand the other person, it
is not guaranteed that it will be understood by them. In fact, they
may even return it with poisonous malice.

No matter how devout a believer may be, Lord Lestat is not omniscient
or omnipotent. He cannot heal or save everyone.

First, get close to the people around you, and those who reach out to
you. First, love your neighbor, and if you still can't reach them,
love that neighbor too.
Hey \n[16], are you okay? You haven't had much of an appetite lately.

Do you want to eat my snack...? You don't have to force yourself, you
know...?

Enicia nee-chan... Something's wrong with [16]. She only ate 2 pieces
of bread and 1 bowl of soup this morning...

But compared to before, you're definitely not eating as much. Are you
really okay?
Okay. My stomach and my heart are full.
I see... Well, that's good then.

It's like... I've awakened to some kind of maiden's heart or
something...
Ahaha... You're still a mysterious child, aren't you?

The former capital of Megista, the central city of the Melgius
territory, was troubled by various incidents such as the outbreak of
evil spirits and monsters, and the unexplained Black Mark disease.

Such ominous events gradually cast a dark shadow over the territory,
and the people living there were also losing their vitality.

However, at some point, those dark clouds cleared up like a lie...
Although it didn't return to the way it was when it was the capital,
it was regaining a bright liveliness.

In Megista's commercial district, there is a small church on Horseshoe
Street that is run by nuns for some reason, without a priest.

The people who visit her there affectionately call her the Little
Saint of Horseshoe Street, as she always greets them with a gentle
demeanor.
オープニングスキップ
……Why are you coming to my house... Mutter...

Uh, well... I'm sorry, but I couldn't think of a better place than
somewhere other than the church...

Yes, she is a friend of mine. The black cat is Momoko-san. She is a
very nice person, so it should be okay even if you ask about her...
……I see. If you say so, it's fine.

Explorer \n[46], Ed the former knight, and Mayvin the necromancer of
Spirit Descent... These are individuals who have committed various
criminal acts both inside and outside of Megista.

Enicia-san. Thanks to you, we were able to capture them. This
contribution is immeasurable. I know I've said it many times, but as a
knight who protects the people, I am grateful.
No, it's nothing. It just happened that way...

(...Ah, this sounds like it could be troublesome... I'll pretend I didn't
hear it...)

With such wonderful people around, why is faith in the Lester religion
declining in Megista... Well, there are suspicious circumstances
around that as well...

Please don't worry about it. Anyway, it's about the criminals. They
were quite tight-lipped, but they finally gave us information through
interrogation.

……Surprisingly, they were all acting for the same purpose. They were
messengers of those who call themselves the Former Nobles.

I still don't know their true identity. However... when it comes to
former nobles in the Del Kingdom, there is one thing that comes to
mind.

Undead King Agor... Agor Aman Del, the king of Megista when it was
still the capital. He was a tyrant who was overthrown by a rebellion
of the surrounding lords and the church coalition, and was known for
his cruelty.

The nobles who sided with Agor during the rebellion had their noble
titles stripped after the transfer of the throne. It is common to
refer to them as former nobles.

Mysteriously, those who call themselves former nobles... And
apparently, the ones acting under their orders are the Jemmett
Company.

I understand your circumstances to some extent. There must be some
connection with the Jemmett Company.
Yes... However, we should have already resolved that issue...

But... I was bothered by the fact that the explorer who kidnapped
\n[12], Mr. \n[46], mentioned my debt for some reason...

……The employer of \n[46] who caused that incident. They are the Former
Nobles.

We'll have to talk about it one by one... Let's talk about the
information we obtained from the captured individuals.

First, let's talk about the former knight Ed who caused the monster
incident.
Ed's Connection with the Former Aristocrats
元騎士のエドについて

Former knight, Ed Popo... It's shameful for the people that someone
like him called himself a knight. His false loyalty to Your Excellency
is also unforgivable. \n[29]
At least Ed had the ability as a knight. I had some respect for him...

Ed Popo scattered the food that monsters like throughout various
places in his territory, causing abnormal monster occurrences.

Zimmer's black grass, a plant from the north that emits an unbearable
odor for humans, but conversely, many monsters like this odor. They
mixed it with meat and fish and used it as bait.

As a result, not only monsters that originally lived deep in the
forests and mountains, but also monsters that did not originally exist
in the Melgius territory began to appear.

Recently, many members of the guard and knights have been mobilized to
deal with it. Another reason was the lack of weapons and armor for
other reasons, which also contributed to the lack of progress in
dealing with it.

And during that time, the maintenance of public order in the city of
Megista had long been neglected. That was also one of the reasons why
suspicious individuals were allowed to run wild.

The Popopo family apparently had the technology to train such monsters
from the beginning... But the ones who supplied them with the
necessary Zimmer's black grass were... Yes, it was the Zimet Trading
Company.
エドと"旧貴族"の繋がり

The Popopo family was also one of the former nobles who were deprived
of their noble status when they sided with King Agor during the
rebellion.

Although he is of former noble blood, Ed Popo is a commoner... He was
able to achieve results and receive a knighthood, but a commoner
cannot rise above that one-time noble status.

The idea that a commoner who becomes a knight is not a true noble is
deeply rooted. If Ed had been a bloodline supremacist... it wouldn't
be strange to be dissatisfied with that.

Next is... about a necromancer named Meiven who caused the evil spirit
incident.
About the Medium of Summoning Spirits
Connection between Maven and Former Nobles
降霊のメイブンについて

Meiven the Necromancer... She is the mastermind behind the large-scale
evil spirit incident that has been troubling Megista.

A sorcerer who manipulates advanced necromancy... A practitioner of
magic known as a necromancer who specializes in summoning undead.

To say that she has been abandoned by the Lester Church... would be
rude, but in Megista where there are few high-ranking clergymen, she
is an extremely dangerous opponent.

The evil spirit incident caused by Meiven was one of the elaborate
schemes to weaken Megista.

The main targets were craftsmen... The evil spirits that were summoned
in large numbers were at most just frightening and breaking things,
but the craftsmen were demotivated by the evil spirits that
persistently appeared in their homes and workshops, and many of them
left Megista.

As a result, the production of weapons, especially armor,
significantly declined. There was a shortage of weapons even for the
guards, and they struggled to deal with the monster outbreak mentioned
earlier.

Your Lordship tried to buy weapons from neighboring lords, but for
some reason, a certain trading company had already monopolized them.

That's right. Also, the strange stone you found on the South Road...
the Stone of the Dark Oath. Meiven obtained that through the trading
company as well.

It seems to be something used to make a contract with the dead. I've
never heard of manipulating the dead in such a way...

In any case, she was disturbingly accurate in trying to exploit
Megista's weaknesses. Thanks to you, we were able to avoid the worst-
case scenario, but...

It is unknown what the trading company and Meiven were aiming for...
However, if a large army of monsters attacked while there was a
shortage of weapons, we might not have been able to handle it.
メイブンと"旧貴族"の繋がり

He had something. Its existence was questionable, but it was said to
be the property of the Undead King Agor, and it was like a book that
contained all of that magic.

Undead King Agor was skilled in necromancy, and as his name suggests,
there is evidence that he controlled countless undead as military and
labor force.

However, there was no trace of the whereabouts of the book that
recorded the magic. The reason for possessing such a valuable item...

If what they call the former nobles really refers to the nobles under
King Agor, then it all makes sense.

Finally... it's about the explorer \n[46] who kidnapped an orphan
named \n[12].

This man seems to be just a hired hand. He confessed to receiving
money from the former nobles and kidnapping \n[12].

Originally, he was a man with bad behavior as an explorer, leaking
outside information such as the Explorer Association's confidential
information, secrets shared among explorer colleagues, and explorer
schedules.

Not only that, but it seems she was involved in various crimes such as
providing guidance to tomb raiders, illegal buying and selling of
discovered relics, and others... all taking advantage of her position
as an explorer.

……Well, since their behavior had already been reported to the branch
chief of the Megista Explorers Association \n[40], this man was
already done for anyway...

Just after you finished repaying your debt to the trading company, it
seems this man received a direct request from a messenger of the
former nobles.

One thing to be concerned about is that kidnapping and human
trafficking are much more serious and risky acts than theft.

That being said, there must be a reason why a man who had been
committing cheap crimes related to theft suddenly got involved in such
a risky crime.

Were they threatened, offered a considerable amount of money, or
perhaps some other, more special reward...?

………….I don't know if it's related, but... in that warehouse, \n[46]
mentioned the words Blessing of the Black Mark.

That's how they put it, saying that they committed the kidnapping
incident in order to obtain it.

……I see. Black Mark... it certainly is concerning. It's unclear if
there's any connection to the Black Mark Disease that threatens
Megista, but...

At the very least, it must be something of value that they want badly
enough to take various risks...

……For now, that's all the information we could gather from the three of
them.

All three of them had a connection to the former nobles... That much
is clear... But what is the true identity and purpose of these former
nobles?

……I don't know. It's certain that they're committing acts that lead to
Megista's decline, but currently we don't even know who the members of
the former nobles are or where they are.

We have no choice but to ask the president of the Jimet Company, who
is known to have connections with the former nobles.

And there's one more thing that worries me. Among the people who had
connections with the former nobles... there was someone whose name
came up.

……I see. A man who often goes in and out of the St. Lumineia Church...
\n[25]. That's the reason he didn't want to be asked about it.

T-That's... Could it be a mistake? Enicia has been treated kindly by
that person since the time when Priest Merleku was there...

I understand that you want to believe that... but the fact is that a
name came up.

But at the very least, he doesn't seem to have any special skills or
abilities. It doesn't seem like he's caused any large-scale incidents
like the others.

For now, we don't know. We are considering whether to detain and
interrogate him or not...
Before that, I think it might be better to talk about it just in case.
Understood. Thank you very much. ...First, please let me speak.

Understood. However, if anything happens, make sure the guards
intervene.
Thank you very much, Enicia-san, for lending us the place. \n[34]
……W-Well...it's fine. So, he's your friend, right?

……By the way, umm... Did you say Momoko-san? Is it okay if I touch that
girl...?

Eh!? ...I-It's fine though... Ah, just so you know, she gets angry if
you pat her head...

(\n[25]... I hope it's just a mistake... Anyway, let's go listen to
what they have to say.)

parameters.purpose:
Enicia heard about the connection between the Jemmett
Company and those who have caused incidents so far in the
knight's \n[35]. And the name of \n[25] was also mentioned
among those related to the company and the former nobles.
She didn't want to believe it, but she decided to go talk to
\n[25] directly.

parameters: >Wizardry Skill and Titles [Author: Sage Mabel Haan]

When a wizard's mastery of magic reaches a certain level, they are
officially recognized as being proficient in that type of magic, and
are given a title based on a color such as Crimson, Azure, Emerald,
Black, White, Rainbow, etc.

In addition to the color, a rank indicating the level is also given as
a suffix. Stone is given to skilled practitioners. Jade indicates a
master who can be called a master. Crystal is only reached by those
who have reached the realm called Sage.

These are based on the grades of gems that were used in the eastern
part of the continent. As spirits are more likely to inhabit higher-
grade gems, they are used as titles to indicate a wizard's
proficiency.

For example, in the case of Crimson Jade, the title indicates that the
wizard is a master of fire magic, with Crimson representing the color
and Jade indicating mastery.

If you have obtained titles in multiple systems, it is generally
common to use the title of the highest-ranking system or the system
that the person is confident in as their specialty.

Exceptionally, there is no Stone rank for Rainbow magic. This is
because the conditions for being recognized as a Rainbow wizard
require proficiency in seven or more types of magic at the level of
Gem or higher.

7Due to the difficult conditions of being recognized as a master of
seven or more systems, very few have been given the title of Rainbow
Gem, and there are only a few in history who have reached Rainbow
Crystal.

The title is a great honor for a wizard, and even the lowest rank of
Stone is respected by many.

Even successful wizards mostly stop at Stone, and Jade can only be
reached by talented individuals after many years. As for Crystal, most
of them are legendary wizards.

These are given as honorary titles from the highest magic academy, the
Round Table of Sages.

There are no special privileges granted, but there are great benefits
to being recognized as a skilled practitioner, as it is a clear
indicator of one's abilities.

These titles are only applied to those recognized by the Round Table
of Sages as skilled practitioners of magic.

Regarding the use of miracles such as divine magic Theurgi[a], it is
not included in any system, as the Round Table of Sages does not
consider it as magic in the first place.
Could it be... does it smell like perfume around here?
……I see. In that case, this place is...
I heard a voice... Who's there? I didn't hear anything.
(This is bad... I'll be found out. ...W-What should I do...)

Jeez, it's about time for the company to make a move. They won't be
able to find this lodge though...

Mr. \n[21] is also suspicious... but even more so are those geezers
called former nobles, they give me the creeps.
(Now, I did mention the lodge. In that case, this place is indeed it.)
Oh, hello. Are you hungry? Thank you, Momoko-san. Let's meet again.

Momoko walked away slowly... But it seems she warmed up to me a bit.
If I call her again, she might come.
……I should also return and report to the knight once.

parameters.purpose:

There is a high possibility that \n[21] is also here.
However, it would be reckless to go in by ourselves. It's
better to talk to \n[35] and leave it to the knights.

parameters: \>Morvink the Poisonous Dragon \>[Author: Sage Mabel Haan]

A species of dragon that remains in the legends of the Carbine
Dynasty. Its breath pollutes the air and generates a widespread
poison.

That vast amount of poison is thought to be a reaction when breathing
out, rather than something accumulated in the body.

※Dragon species use spirits as a source of activity, and their unique
breath often utilizes the power of spirits.

Just as the current Melgius territory, it was contaminated by
Morvink's poisonous breath and turned into a land of death.

It is believed that many structures from the Carbine Dynasty,
including the Dearsia Ruins, were built underground to escape from
Morvink's poisonous breath.

However, the Carbine Dynasty, which could no longer engage in
production activities on the ground, eventually declined.

During the decline and fall of the Carbine Dynasty, it is known that
Morvink also died for reasons that are not clear.

Bones that are said to be part of Morvink's body were found in the
Melgius territory, but only a small amount remains with traces that
seem to have been dissolved. In addition, no bones such as the head or
horns have been found.

So it's over now. There's no need to worry about the repayment
deadline anymore.

……Phew. It's like I let my guard down after feeling relieved... It was
tough, wasn't it...

For now, should we take a break for today? I feel like exhaustion is
creeping up on me.

parameters.purpose:
The debt to the Gimlet Trading Company has been repaid.
Although there are many things to consider, for today, I
will sleep in the bed next to the church's office.

parameters: テキスト = ジメット商会への借金の返済が終わった。 色々と考…
\>About Divine Art Theurg[y]\> [Author: Kohak[u] Danning Black]
The Evidence That Divine Arts Are Non-Magical
魔法<ゴエティア>との違い

Divine Art is fundamentally different from other magic, so the magic
academy Round Table of Wise Men distinguishes most of the spirit magic
and curses as magic Goeti[a], and Divine Art as miracles Theurgi[a].

The Goeti[a] of spirit magic and curses have been somewhat
systematized, making it possible to leave magic as a theory. As a
result, it has become possible to learn it through practice up to a
certain level.

On the other hand, Theurgi[a] like Divine Art is called a 'miracle',
and it is said that it is caused by mystery itself, and that it is
impossible to clarify its mechanism or principle.
神聖術が非魔法である根拠

Manifesting divine art is purely through prayer and wishes, and spells
are considered to be nothing more than a way to strengthen the image.

<Although there are non-chanting spells as a technique in the practice
of Goetia, they are nothing more than a substitute for chanting
through some kind of ritual.

For these reasons, Divine Art is fundamentally different from
Goeti[a], and because its acquisition and exercise are greatly
influenced by the individual's aptitude, it is not considered as a
systematized academic study of magic by the Round Table of Wise Men,
which defines it as not being magic.

According to the elderly wise woman Mabel Haan of the Round Table of
Wise Men, Goeti[a] is a redesign of phenomena that imitates the world,
while Theurgi[a] is the mystery itself that is the prototype of the
world.
The Founding of the Barren Land and the Del Kingdom

First king of the Del Kingdom, the great warrior and king, Sisias Del.
After the downfall of the Carvain Dynasty, he opened up the vast
wasteland that had become a breeding ground for monsters, which is now
the current territory of Melgius.

Sisias was the leader of a tribe called Zengel, and it is said that he
also had the blood of the Carvain royal family in his lineage. This is
inferred from remaining documents, but there is no clear evidence.
不毛の地とデル王国の建国

At that time, the land was under the control of the major tribe of
Frosleen, and there were also numerous dangerous monsters inhabiting
it. The poisonous swamp, said to have been born from the breath of a
poison dragon, spread out and it was an uninhabitable land for humans.

The surrounding countries have abandoned the wasteland as a dangerous
and worthless land, and the purpose of the Zengel tribe heading to
that barren land is unknown. It is said that it was to escape from the
oppression of minority groups or to revive the fallen Carvain.

Sisias led warriors from his tribe and explorers hired with gold to
drive away the Frosleen of this land, exterminate monsters, and
reclaim the poisonous swamp.

And so, the Del Kingdom was founded and a capital was built. Some of
the explorers who accompanied the Zengel tribe also settled as
citizens.

The revival of the land contaminated by poison was not easy, but many
treasures from the Carvain Dynasty were sleeping in the underground
ruins, and the treasures brought back by the explorers brought great
wealth.

At first, the surrounding countries laughed at the barren land, but
they began to claim ownership of the land with great interest.

Soon, the surrounding countries invaded the territory. The number of
invading soldiers amounted to tens of thousands, and it was expected
that the newly established Del Kingdom would be trampled upon.

However, the Zengel tribe who became soldiers of the Del Kingdom were
not only very strong warriors, but also wore magical weapons
discovered from the ruins of the Carvain Dynasty.

Furthermore, it is said that they skillfully used the land
contaminated with poison for defense and achieved military exploits
such as repelling tens of thousands of soldiers with only a thousand
troops.

And so, the Del Kingdom, which showed its power to the surrounding
countries, and the unnamed royal capital gradually developed under the
great king Sisias, expanding their territory and purifying the
contaminated land with a large amount of alchemy medicine.
偉大なる都・メギスタ

After Sisias' death, the capital, which had long been nameless, was
given the name Megista, a great city, in honor of the king.

Since then, the royal capital Megista has long boasted prosperity, but
since the rebellion under the rule of the undead king Agor, plans for
relocation have been made.

Reasons for relocation vary, such as the aging of the capital and the
bordering of the royal capital. It is said that King Tanabotta, who
succeeded the throne in a form of coup d'etat from Agor, was also
afraid of the curse of the undead king.

The capital was moved, but the first king Sisias is still a source of
pride for many people. In front of the royal castle of the current
capital city of Albedia, there is a huge monument praising Sisias.
\> About the Black Spot Disease \> [Author: Ellen Kanika]

The Black Spot Disease is a unique disease found only in the vicinity
of Megista. The cause of its onset is not yet known and there are many
mysteries surrounding it.

Since the time of Megista, the number of people affected by this
disease has increased, and although there has been no explosive
increase in patients since then, it has not been eradicated and there
are always a certain number of patients.

As for the time of onset, it was within a few years after the end of
the reign of King Agor when Megista was the capital. There are also
records of reports of similar symptoms prior to that.

When infected, black spots appear somewhere on the body and the person
becomes weakened. The spots may appear faintly like bruises or they
may appear clearly as pattern-like markings, as the name suggests.

The characteristic of this disease is that there are no symptoms that
directly threaten life. Although there are cases where a weakened
state may lead to secondary loss of life if there are pre-existing
conditions such as chronic illness, in most cases, there is no danger
to life despite the weakness.

There is currently no fundamental treatment method, and the only way
to deal with it is to maintain physical strength by nourishing the
body as much as possible and being careful not to contract other
diseases.
>The Great Storm of the Skira Archipelago [Author: Sakana Trail]

A great storm that rarely occurs in the northeast of the Kerbes Island
in the western continent. If you're a sailor, you've probably heard of
it at least once.

The cause of this is the individual dragon species that claims the
entire surrounding sea area as its territory. The dragon species has a
nature that carries spirits, and this particularly powerful individual
alone can cause a great storm just by existing.

The great storm caused by the disturbance of spirits generated by the
dragon, rampages across the sea, involving countless sharks.

Many sailors who unfortunately encounter it become confused and are
unable to go out to sea for a while afterwards. And they say this:
There's no way sharks can fly!

\>World Religions \>-About the Lester Religion and its Beliefs-
[Author: Unknown]
"Name of Choice: Rista the Reviver and her true name
The End of the World and the Fifth Age

Lester is said to be the god of the Fourth Era (present day),
who revived and reconstructed the land destroyed by the war between
humans and demons in ancient times. In fact, he is also considered the
creator god of the current world.

Lester is not a proper name, but a title that means Savior of the
World. There is a doctrine that one should not call the name of the
Lord in vain, so this title is usually used.

It is unknown what form he takes, and it is forbidden by the Gospel
Agency to represent his form as an idol, but a figure resembling the
number 8 is shown as a symbol.

As a god, he has both a compassionate side and a strict side. On one
hand, he sent the first apostle, Berk Hermitt, for the salvation of
the people, but on the other hand, there is also a legend that he
brought divine punishment to a corrupt nation.

The Lester Religion is one of the world's largest religions and has
spread widely throughout the northern and western parts of the
Seogonia continent. It is said to account for one-third of the
continent's faith.

The founder of the Lester Religion is said to be the first apostle
sent to the earth by Lester, Berk Hermitt. Through his words and
miracles, many believers were born, and the Berk Doctrines, which
became the basis of the Lester Religion, were born.

Afterwards, the Lester religion, which diverged due to differences in
the interpretation of the prophecies, was born, and it has now become
the mainstream denomination.

As a major difference, while the Berk doctrines do not recognize any
other gods, the Lester religion acknowledges the existence of other
gods, although it is considered as a type of higher elemental spirit.

Due to its ancient origins, there are various bloody histories, but as
a current trend, it is extremely moderate and is increasing its
followers through missionary work and charitable donations.

In the sacred text Berk Prophecy, there are also descriptions about
the end of the world. The world will be covered in sin, the war
between humans and demons will happen again, and it will be destroyed.

『When this Fourth Era comes to an end, the world will once again be
revived by Lester. And those who are qualified to live in the kingdom
of God will be promised the regeneration of their souls and bodies.

『The next era, the Fifth Era, will become the age of the gods. Under
the rule of Lester, an eternal paradise without conflict or suffering
will come.

The sentence that only Lester believers will be resurrected after
death and enjoy eternal life and peace has become a cornerstone of the
hearts of believers that continues to grow on a global scale.
The Gem is the Abode of Spirits

Gems and precious stones that exist on the earth's veins sometimes
become the dwelling place of spirits that flow through the veins. Such
things are also called spirit stones and are highly valued.

Exceptions exist, but generally, minerals with homogeneous and
excellent crystal structures, in other words, beautiful gems, are more
likely to house spirits.

Not only the quality of the gemstones, but also the type of mineral,
the content they contain, and the balance of the content determine the
spirits that inhabit them.

For example, even among minerals derived from the same corundum,
rubies are more likely to gather fire spirits, while aquamarines are
more likely to house water spirits.

In spirit contracts, this property is utilized. It is common to make
contracts with spirits that inhabit gems or to place high-quality gems
on the earth's veins to invite spirits.

It is said that gemstones inhabited by spirits shine more beautifully
and are traded at high prices even for jewelry purposes.

There are beautiful diamonds called Rainbow Stones or Rainbow Crystals
that shine in seven colors, where multiple attribute spirits coexist
within spirit stones. They are very rare, and those that exist in the
Del Kingdom are worth approximately 2 billion \G in currency value.

Sometimes, multiple lower-level spirits inhabit opals. Although they
are also very valuable, the market price is relatively inexpensive
compared to rainbow gems, at around tens of thousands of \G.
\>Carbine Annals \>[Author: Elmore Carbine, the Golden King]
The Reign and Demise of the Poison Dragon
Items Brought Back by the Exploration Team

The evil dragon Morvink dominates the sky and has turned the land of
the Carbine Kingdom into a poisoned wasteland.

We have been forced to live underground for a long time. We cannot see
the sun, plants do not grow, and the food we can produce is limited.
The people have survived by relying on magic technology.

However, before we knew it... that dreadful roar that even echoed
underground had ceased.

We have prepared equipment enchanted with the best anti-poison magic
possible and sent an exploration team to the surface, fully aware of
the dangers.
探索隊の持ち帰ったもの
The result brought back by the exploration team was astonishing.

That evil dragon was already dead. And there were those who were
devouring its body.
An unbelievably huge, gelatinous monster... It was a Gelian.

There are many mysteries surrounding the creature known as Gelian, but
there are no records of a body as large as the one reported.

According to the exploration team, the giant Gelian disappeared
shortly after being discovered by the team, leaving only its partially
eaten head behind.

I have caught the whereabouts of the Gelian that devoured Morvink, but
I have no intention of doing anything. It's because there's nothing I
can do.

Even if the poisonous dragon has been defeated now, the Carbine
Kingdom is already on the brink of destruction. It is likely that I
will be the last king.

The poisonous dragon's breath still lingers on the surface, and it is
still difficult to even go outside without equipping oneself with
anti-poison gear, let alone rebuilding.

The only thing I can do is to at least let the remaining people
escape. As the last king, I will see the fate of this land to the end.

I hope that the people who escaped will live safely somewhere and
leave behind the blood of Carbine.
固有イベント呼び出し

>Rastium Creatures - Demons from the Lewd World - [Author: Isaac
Gossark]

In this world, there are monsters called Rastium creatures that have
locally unique ecosystems. The representative of these creatures is
the tentacle creature.

Tentacle creatures often target humans and their sub-races, especially
females, and their ecology of teasing the erogenous zones and
reproductive organs of captured prey with their tentacles is well
known.

Their ecology is specialized in making prey submit to pleasure, with
tentacles of various evolved shapes and body fluids with powerful
aphrodisiac effects. There are also individuals who acquire special
abilities such as hypnosis, albeit rarely.

The fate of the prey captured by tentacle creatures varies, but they
are often used as breeding grounds to increase the number of
individuals.

In the vicinity of areas where Rastium creatures have been sighted, it
is extremely common for women to go missing.

They will actively counterattack against objects that they do not
recognize as prey. Due to their numbers and vitality, extermination is
a highly difficult and dangerous task.

On the other hand, they have a nature of not taking the life of their
prey, even if attacked, if they have identified them as potential
breeding grounds. Therefore, although extermination is dangerous, it
is often carried out by women.

In this world, there are several layers. The confirmed ones include
the material layer, the mental layer, and the spiritual layer.

It is said that somewhere other than the material layer exists the
world where the succubi live, the Lewd World Rastium.

It is said that the current form of Rastium creatures, which should
originally inhabit that world, appeared in the terrestrial world for
some reason and multiplied.

In addition to tentacle creatures, there are several types of monsters
belonging to the Rastium creature group that have been confirmed.

Beasts, insects, amorphous beings, and those that do not take on a
biological form, they have a wide variety of appearances.

Once, there was a theory that Gelians were also one of their kind, but
it has been denied due to clear differences in ecology.

children under your care with you?

I took in the baby who grew up splendidly inside the magic uterus...
From now on, let's raise them in the orphanage.
Yes, everyone has been discharged. ...It's a little lonely, isn't it?

As it is still a fetus, I cannot take it out from the magic uterus
yet. Please wait a moment.
You can take them in after clearing the main story.
A few days passed... ※This is not reflected in the in-game calendar.
There, there. It's alright. Please lie down.
Okay... Please hang in there. It's just a little bit more.
You did it. Congratulations. You did well.
Enicia gave birth to the child <\v[193]> that was in her stomach...

I will use a small teleportation magic to transfer the child in your
stomach to the magic uterus. You shouldn't feel any discomfort, but
please let me know if you feel anything ♪

Enicia had the child \v[193] in her stomach transferred to the
magic uterus...

……This child is a monster. It's unfortunate, but we have to dispose of
it according to the laws of the kingdom. Do you understand?
I will refund you here. Well then...
\n[61] took the newborn monster and went somewhere...
The number of children has exceeded 20, so we cannot take in any more.

As a foster parent has been found for the child she gave birth to, it
has been decided to give the child up for adoption...
This child is a \c[6]boy\c[0], right? Please decide on a name for him.

This child is a \c[6]girl\c[0], right? Please decide on a name for
her.

(Regardless of the circumstances, this child was born into this world.
We must raise them in good health...)
\c[6]\n[142] \c[0]Do you want to change the name to \v[191]?
マップイベント呼び出し
マップイベント呼び出し

As expected, you move quickly. Your reputation as a young knight
expected by the lord is not just for show.

Enough with the small talk. Enicia, President of the Jimet Company,
your misdeeds have come to light.

Misdeeds? Well... I have only been doing the deals that were always
demanded of me...

I have evidence of dealing with prohibited items such as the 'Black
Grass of Zymel'.
Oops... I certainly can't make excuses for that. Kukuku...

Are you guys the Former Nobles who call themselves such dishonorable
people?

……You are quite rude for someone who is so dishonorable. Show some
manners.
Who needs manners when dealing with thieves?

I am the head of the Botura Duchy, a former noble of the Del Kingdom.
On my right is the head of the Poppo Earldom, and on my left is the
head of the Grillo Barony.
I have no intention of listening to your nonsense and delusions.

Pfft... Kukuku... Knights, without a doubt, you are the vassals of
King Agor... The former heads of the extinct noble families.

……That's impossible. If that were true, the people sitting there would
have been alive for over a hundred years.

Well... It's possible, you know. Those people have survived until now
thanks to the Black Mark.

According to the child of my wizard friend, Black Mark is caused by a
curse... That's what I heard. Does that have anything to do with it?

You seem to have an excellent friend. That's correct. The symptoms of
the Black Mark are the result of genuine sorcery.

Those who have contracted the Black Mark or have been in close contact
with patients must surely think that there is something strange about
this disease.

……Please tell me, what is the Black Mark? What is the relationship
between the Black Mark Disease?

The Black Mark is a type of contract mark, Enicia... just like the one
you have. Roughly speaking, the only difference is the content of the
contract.
……！　Black Mark is a contract mark...?

The Black Mark is a type of contract magic. It is a life-providing
contract that is exchanged for a price... the sacrifice of one's own
life.

These former nobles have received vitality from the residents of
Megista through the Black Mark, and have extended their lifespan as a
result.
……That...there's no way such a contract could exist...

Originally, it was a sorcery used by their lord, King Agor. The
nickname Undead King of King Agor is by no means an exaggeration.

The king made a contract with the people and became immortal... Ah,
thanks to that, he was able to avoid assassination several times.

……You speak as if you have seen it before. Are you also one of those
former nobles who have extended their lifespan with the Black Mark?

No, no, there's no way. While it's true that I taught King Agor and
the former nobles there the contract magic, I myself don't even need
something like the Black Mark.

What are you exactly, \n[21]...? I didn't think you were just an
ordinary merchant...

It's a rather meaningless question. If you could just think of me as a
merchant with a policy of fair trade...

……Trade... Speaking of contracts, what kind of contract did the king and
former nobles make with the people of Megista?

Why are there still people suffering from the Black Mark? Please tell
me.

Certainly... From what I have seen of people suffering from the Black
Mark, it is impossible for them to have given up their lives by
agreement.

That's not entirely true. King Agor once made an equal contract with
the people based on mutual agreement. It promised eternal protection
and collected a small amount of life force as compensation.

King Agor's contract was made with all the people of the capital at
that time. Therefore, in terms of individual burden, it was not even
significant enough to be aware of. So, at least the people of the
capital at that time accepted it.

You may not believe it, but King Agor at that time was very popular
among the people around the capital.

Using the contract of Meiyaku, they controlled the dead with sorcery
and protected the area around the capital from threats such as
monsters and Floselin that attacked from the north. The Black Mark is
the price to use that power.

However... for the Restia religion, they were nothing but evil
sorcery, and it became the trigger for the rebellion.

Well, let's leave the talk about the king. The Black Mark appeared
after King Agor was killed... after that era had ended.

The nobles who fought against King Agor... the former nobles had their
noble titles stripped from them, although they were spared from
execution.

They went down to the common people and continued to hold secret
meetings in this lodge, imitating King Agor and desiring immortality
through the Black Mark under the pretext of inheriting the king's
will.

However, those who escaped after having their noble titles abolished
would not be able to make equal transactions with the people.

They have taken hostages, deceived, and threatened... and have forced
the people into contracts against their will.

They burdened us with debts that couldn't be resolved in one
generation, and made it so that the Black Mark would be passed down
for generations... That's why the current Black Mark patients don't
even know that such a contract exists.

However, in the end, it's impossible to be like the king who made a
contract with all the people. With fewer contract targets, the
collection of life force per person increases significantly.

And thus, they continue to be drained of excessive life force due to
their unconscious contract... That is the true nature of the Black
Mark disease.

Director Narsia seemed fine until recently... so why did she
suddenly contract the Black Mark disease?

It seems that there are cases where the Black Mark, which became
incomplete as time passed, suddenly manifests itself as the years go
by.

Still, the amount of life force collected was not enough, and in
recent years they have used orphans from the shady alleys...

\n[21]...! You've been talking too much about unnecessary things since
earlier...
You know, right? I'm a creature that can't lie...
If that's the case, at least don't talk!

Kukukuku... That's tough. I love to talk, you see... Yes, yes, I
understand.

In other words, for the past hundred or so years since the time of
King Agor, they have been living by sucking the lives of the people of
Megista.

The former nobles of Megista... It's hard to believe, but... You guys
are the root of all evil that has been weakening the power of the
territory for many years due to the exclusion of the Rista Church,
the decrease in the loyalty of the lords, and various other
hindrances.

It's not just our fault. It's the incompetence of the successive lords
after the capital was moved, the corruption of the people... all of
that.

Insulting the Merugius family will never be forgiven. Above all, the
crime of toying with Enicia's life here is severe.
\n[21]! Are you listening? Why are you silent!?
Oh my, is it okay to talk?

Even if you ask me to do something... I am a contracted creature.
Without a contract, I cannot provide any benefits or harm. I have
explained this to you many times before.

Kuh... You speak as if it's none of your concern. Haven't you also
desired that little girl Enicia over there?

It's not like I'm in as much of a hurry as you are... I don't want to
say it again, but I'm a contracted creature... I have no choice but to
give up once the contract is fulfilled.

I do not care what you do during the process leading up to the
contract. Whether you take hostages, deceive, or threaten...

However, it is a rule for us to abide by the contents of the contract
that has been made. It is not an exaggeration to say that it is the
foundation of our existence.

Once Enicia over there fulfills the contract safely, my job will be
done. Once that happens, my title as the president of the Jimet
Company will also come to an end, so I have already completed the
handover on that side as well.

I don't really understand, but it seems like \n[21] doesn't have the
intention to fight. ... For now, I will detain you on suspicion of
rebellion against His Majesty the King of Del Kingdom, as well as the
head of the Melgius family, and His Excellency Aldam.

……Don't underestimate us just because we're not young knights like you.
We haven't just grown old without achieving anything.

Do you know? The area around Megista was once a poisonous swamp
threatened by a poisonous dragon in ancient times.

You will witness a glimpse of the terror of that era... You may
tremble in fear.

Oh my, oh my... To do that in a place like this? Truly lacking in
morals...

We have found a part of the monster that led to the downfall of the
Carvain Dynasty in this land, which died and became a corpse.

To make a contract with the dead, the curse of the Netherworld
Covenant... With that, I became a servant.
This is the greatest power for us to eventually make a comeback! Go!

Phew... It is certainly a fearsome thing, but it is just a corpse
after all...

(That being said... If Enicia wasn't here, it would have been
dangerous.)
……Old nobles. If you were also nobles of Megista, please, no more...

Hmm... With this state of affairs, we no longer have the power to
fight.

That brat from the Melgius family, the eccentric Aurum, the adventurer
woman from the Exploration Association... and even a nun who uses
miracles... They all got in the way...

I have heard that what happened to Sister \n[25] was also under your
orders... Why did you do such a thing to a nun like me...?

We remember... the miraculous power of that girl named Luminea. If
that girl wasn't there, his majesty Agor wouldn't have been defeated.

His Majesty Agor was wise and also had excellent skills in curses.
However... he underestimated the power of the miracle called Sacred
Arts.

In order for us to make a comeback, we must eliminate the Rista Faith.
Especially those who use Sacred Arts... Even though we failed, I am
now convinced that it was the right decision.

……The contract with the Black Mark and the people of Megista has been
terminated. There will be no more cases of the Black Mark disease.
……Surprisingly, you have a good sense of when to give up.

……Hmph. Even though I am the head of an old noble family, I cannot
behave so disgracefully until the end, as I have my family's name to
uphold.
……I see. Let's capture them somewhat politely.

But do not forget... the old noble families are not just us. As long
as there is arrogance in the young lords and knights like you, we will
surely rise again...!

Enicia captured the men who claimed to be old nobles and handed them
over to the guards... \n[35]

Your first impression of me hasn't changed. I'm a suspicious, just an
evil nightmare.

Residents of Lastium. Devils, nightmares, succubi... and also contract
beasts. You can call us whatever you like.

Without a contract, it is difficult to manifest in this world... That
is what I am.

The King of Agor and the old nobles were really good customers. Thanks
to them, I have been active in the surface world for almost 200 years
now.

……Earlier, you said something that made it seem like you had a purpose
for me...

I wasn't particularly attached, it was just a job on the side... But
yes, that's correct.

You are the same as us... You smell like Lastium. It's probably
because of your distant ancestors' blood...
Yes... When I engraved the first contract mark, I was almost certain.

It's no wonder that curses are less effective on you. After all, you
have similar blood to mine...

……Even if my distant ancestors were like that, I am just a human and a
nun of Lastia.

Hehehe... That's right. That's why it's regrettable. Of all people,
you belong to our natural enemies, the Lastia Church and such. I
wanted to try to convert you.
Well then... If we have the chance, let's meet again.
……It disappeared. That was not a human... It's useless to chase it here.

It's regrettable that we couldn't capture \n[21]... But with this,
things will likely improve for both you and the problems within this
territory.
