\>Former Nobles of the Dell Kingdom - Losers of the Era - \>[Author:
Zerico Catiuma]
アゴール治世下の時代

During the reign of King Agor in the Dell Kingdom, the royal capital
Megista boasted an unprecedented prosperity in the kingdom's history.

On the other hand, the regions far from the capital were relatively
neglected, and many people lived in poverty in contrast to the
prosperity of the capital.

During the reign of King Agor, although it was generally evaluated
positively, there were also many cruel and harsh aspects that accepted
such sacrifices.

Also, there was a rumor that King Agor dealt with magic that controls
immortality. Although assassination attempts occurred twice, King Agor
survived both, and he came to be called the Immortal King because of
these things.

At one point, the high priest of the Rista religion strongly
criticized King Agor, saying, King Agor is using evil magic.

As a result, the high priest of the Rista religion and the lords and
people of the regions who were dissatisfied with King Agor were also
involved, and eventually a large rebellion began to emerge.

Thus, the rebel army and the royal army began to fight around the
royal capital Megista. The western part of the Adjacent Great Forest
and the Danai Plain became the main battlefield.

The royal army was joined by the Duke Botula family, who were
relatives of King Agor, the prestigious warrior family Griot, and the
king's vassal Count Poppor family.

On the other hand, the rebel army was composed of lords from various
parts of the kingdom, as well as neighboring people and followers of
the Rista religion.

There were not few lords who sided with King Agor, but many of them
either joined the rebel side out of fear of the power of the Rista
religion or remained neutral.

Although the number of soldiers was higher on the side of the rebel
army, the army of the royal capital was not only powerful, but
according to remaining testimonies from that time, it had received
significant reinforcement through some kind of magic of King Agor.

Just when it seemed that the rebellion would be suppressed by the
strength of the royal army, a common girl changed the course of
events. She was Enicia, a Rista believer and a saint.

Luminia is said to have been able to handle powerful sacred arts that
are unparalleled in history, and to have completely defeated Agor's
evil magic.

Thanks to the power of Luminia, the rebellion succeeded and King Agor
was killed. The throne was transferred to Duke Tanabotta, who had the
highest right of succession among the rebel forces.

On the other hand, the noble families who sided with Agor were
stripped of their noble status, regardless of their rank, although
they were spared from execution.

They are called the Megista old nobility, and there are some who
succeeded in city politics afterwards, as well as those who
disappeared or whose subsequent movements are unknown.

Also, Agor had a successor, but their right of succession was stripped
and they disappeared into the common people.
\>Melrec's Notes\>On the Flower of Lumina\>[Author: Melrec Main]

This Holy Lumina Church was built on the site of the birthplace of
Lumina, a saint of the Rista Church who played a major role in the
rebellion against the former king, Immortal King Agor.

Perhaps it is the church's blessing, or maybe a miracle of the gods,
but mysterious flowers bloom around the church.

The Flower of Lumina. It is a mysterious flower with beautiful and
vivid petals.

It has an especially strong life force and blooms flowers all year
round. On the other hand, it does not reproduce too much nor does it
scatter seeds to other places. I have never seen such a flower before.

Upon investigation, the medicinal effects of the flower are also very
high. When ground and applied, the pain in my waist that had been
bothering me disappeared.
Addendum: When I ate it pickled in honey, the taste was also good.

Addendum 2: Even the expressionless girl who recently entered the
orphanage seems to like this flower, and when she gazes at it, her
expression seems to soften a bit.
\>Magic book of memories \>[Author: Sage Mabel Haan]

It is said to have been written by numerous powerful wizards, the
magical grimoire of memories Ars[ Memorium].

It is one of the legendary magic books, where magical knowledge is
stored with memories, and it is said that one can instantly learn any
magic written there.

More precisely, not only magic, but also the techniques and empirical
rules of skilled warriors, as well as the intuition of master
craftsmen cultivated over many years, are recorded, and it is said
that they can be inherited.

Once you obtain this book, you can instantly acquire not only the
recorded knowledge but also the techniques.

Because it is such a dreamlike book, there are still those who believe
in its existence and continue to search for it.

Perhaps because of this, scams that use the name of this magic book
have become one of the typical means of fraud for a long time.

It is not uncommon for a mere old book to be put up for auction under
the name Ars Memorium, which has a long history. Even though it is
understood that it cannot be genuine... the fact that it makes one
think maybe is perhaps exactly what makes it a bewitching book.
Well well... today is the repayment deadline...

Geez, the work just keeps coming one after another. It's because this
is an old-fashioned town, so the requests to our place never stop.
マップイベント呼び出し

What, work at this 'Thor Construction' place? We've been getting a lot
of requests lately, so sorry...

……No, as for you... I've heard about you from Names-san and other
craftsmen. They say they've been greatly indebted to you.

If it's you, I'll prioritize your work. If there's anything you need,
just tell me.
(…Can we consult with her about making the orphanage bigger?)

Enicia consulted with the carpenter \n[51] about expanding the

Oh, you want to make the orphanage on the church grounds bigger. But

Considering the size of the land... well, there's only really the

If we expand upwards, we'll have to ask the residents to move out

(...Even if it's just during construction, we can't just kick out those
children and the director. In that case, should we still ask them to
make an underground space?)
I'm sorry, I'll go talk to the orphanage staff once.

Enicia went to the orphanage and explained the situation to the
director, Narsia, and the orphans.

The director didn't have any particular problems with it. The orphans
seemed excited about the possibility of having an underground space.
I understand. Well then, may I ask for your help?

Oh, leave it to me. But... this is about the consultation for the
labor fee... \\c[6] \\v[8] \g \\c[0]Prepare about this much. Once I
receive it, I'll start the work.
